parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
When, at what time. From the base of pou and te; interrogative adverb, at what time.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of semaino; an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To bring to an end, fulfill, accomplish. From sun and teleo; to complete entirely; generally, to execute.
